required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: AM-101 in the Treatment of Post-Acute Tinnitus 1
clinical_study.official_title: AM-101 in the Post-Acute Treatment of Peripheral Tinnitus 1 (AMPACT1) - an Open-Label Extension to the TACTT2 Study

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to test the safety and local tolerance of repeated treatment cycles of AM-101.

detailed_description.textblock: This open-label extension study is assessing the safety and local tolerance of repeated treatment cycles of AM-101 in subjects previously treated in the scope of the TACTT2 study (NCT01803646).

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: Occurrence of deterioration in hearing threshold in the treated ear(s)

secondary_outcome.description: Difference and occurence of deterioration of hearing threshold in the treated ear(s)

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse events and serious adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence and severity of adverse events and serious adverse events
